title: How come Lissandra got her waveclear nerfed before Zed did?
body: If ANYBODY needed a waveclear and lane-safety nerf, it was Zed.

Are you trying to convince people that Lissandra can Q more often than Zed...
She actually can genius. 3 second CD at rank 5 (which is when wave clearing starts to matter).

An exercise in resource management: lv 18 Zed against lv 18 Lissandra. : BEGIN! 

Zed can spam his weq combo (6 seconds of cooldown) followed by eq combo (8 more seconds of cooldown) back to weq combo for ~1:45 without going ooe thanks to his energy returns on mimiced casts. 

Lissandra by comparison using ONLY her q will go oom in ~1:15 seconds. Yes i took into account her free spells. Yes i took into account mana regen. 

Then Zed skips just one eq and gets all his energy back and can continue while Lissandra had to leave.

My point is still 100% valid that she can spam Q much more often than Zed can, and I never said anything about how long she can do it for. You are also looking at an optimal situation for Zed, because his energy costs go down with level. In the mid game (when Lissandra's wave clear is most relevant to the game because the ADC hasn't ramped up all the way) and the time frame that I was discussing (level 9 for maxed Q) her passive has a much larger impact on her spam than Zed's energy return has at that point. Shadow is almost *never* maxed first, and at rank 5 Q, rank 1 W and rank 2 E like he would have at lvl 9, his total energy cost is 145, and his energy return is only 40 (assuming he hits his Q and E twice), meaning every rotation of WQE costs him 105 net energy, which leaves him OOE after 2-3 full rotations at most, but since he only needs to clear a wave every 30 seconds, he could probably stay topped up for a little more than that. Lissandra meanwhile cleared a wave (before the nerf) with only 1-2 Qs and a couple AAs, meaning she could easily out sustain a Zed in the mid game if she is focusing on just pushing the wave as it comes.

Regardless, I don't think either champion is OP or broken really, they are both just a bit strong.

A thought provoking post with some good points. 

> My point is still 100% valid that she can spam Q much more often than Zed can

While that is true my only point is that was not the whole story. 

> You are also looking at an optimal situation for Zed, because his energy costs go down with level.

That is also the optimal situation for Lissandra, because her cd's go down with level and her maximum mana goes up her mana regen goes up by level etc.... 

> her passive has a much larger impact on her spam than Zed's energy return

Zed's 80 energy return (because both q and e give 40 energy return each) gives him more than enough energy for a spell every time his shadow is up, which is 18 seconds at lv 1, so i think they are pretty comparable. 

lv 9 then. 

His weq costs a total of 145 energy with an 80 energy return. + 6 seconds eq costs 105 +6 seconds eq costs 105 +6 seconds weq again. This pattern costs 355 energy, he returned 80, and regenerated 180 energy for a net cost of only 95 energy. You aren't counting his energy regen which makes a HUGE difference. He gets 6 full rotations of abilities on cd and then he skips one eq combo and can continue this pattern. He can use abilities on cd for 5/6 of the time. 

> Regardless, I don't think either champion is OP or broken really, they are both just a bit strong.

I know that neither of them is OP, in fact i think zed is underpowerd but any straight up numbers buffs will likely reinforce a playstyle that is unhealthy for the game. If anything he should be veigar-level reworked without the gutting. In any case i think this exercise into resource management can be enlightening and i find that most people are surprised by zed's actual resource costs when they realize that he can return 80 energy and that procs on minions too.

The energy return actually scales with ranks in W (20/25/30/35/40 energy per double spell hit), so he only gets 40 from hitting both Q and E until W is ranked up. I did account for him getting energy regen, which is why I said instead of running OOE after 2-3 rotations he would be able to do quite a few more by regaining energy naturally between waves. 

My point about Lissandra's passive having more impact is that it gives her a whole free spell, and early on having a whole free spell stretches her mana pool considerably. more than Zed's energy return stretches his, the only difference being that Zed's resource regens faster naturally outside of his energy regaining mechanic.

> The energy return actually scales with ranks in W (20/25/30/35/40 energy per double spell hit)

Touche. at lv 9 you've probably only got one rank in his w. If i redo the math they actually both last around 1:15, so we have come to the conclusion that Zed has comparable (not superior) waveclear to a mage, and doesn't have to go back to regen his resource. 

This is why most people think Zeds waveclear is unfair. He can assassinate, waveclear, roam, splitpush, farm under tower with ease, etc.... He is just good at so many things and waveclear shouldn't be part of an assassins identity, also if his waveclear is nerfed it might be reasonable to increase his assassination power in compensation. If they take away one part of his kit, they can buff another to do something about that 46-47% winrate he's sporting, and i think i speak for most in this thread when i say that his waveclear is a pretty painless place to pull it from.
